Review: Phantom Thread

Daniel Day-Lewis' final film is an understated triumph, writes Martin Kirsch

Review: Downsizing

Jasper Cunningham-Ward is unimpressed by Alexander Payne's ambitious new film

Oscar Shorts 2018: Lost Face

Sean Meehan's impressive and heartfelt short could work as a full feature, writes Jasmine Onstad

Oscar Shorts 2018: My Nephew Emmett

This searing portrait of racism in 1950s America is worthy of its Oscar nomination, writes Andrew Young

Oscar Shorts 2018: Watu Wote: All of us

Emily Taylor takes a look at one of the more politically-charged films on the Oscar shortlist

Review: Paddington 2

Isobel Barrs warmly applauds Paddington's latest charming adventure.

Review: Darkest Hour

Giulia de Vita is impressed by Joe Wright's awards-tipped political drama

Oscar Shorts 2018: The Silent Child

Maddie Scarlett tackles the story of a young deaf girl in this quiet but impressive short

Oscar Shorts 2018: Rise of a Star

Andrew Young looks at this French drama featuring Catherine Deneuve as part of Nouse's look at some shorter Oscar hopefuls

Review: Bright

Netflix's blockbuster hopeful isn't the success they might have hoped, writes Cameron Craig

Review: Star Wars: The Last Jedi

Chay Quinn is full of praise for one of 2017's most anticipated releases

Review: Wonder

James Wright finds this family heart-warmer rather saccharine, but it could be just what you want at Christmas

Review: The Disaster Artist

Euan Brook is left unimpressed by James Franco's cinematic retelling of the making of one of the best-worst movies of all time.

Review: Stronger

Chay Quinn is not completely convinced by David Gordon Green's true-life tale of adversity

Review: Call Me by Your Name

George Melluish has plenty of praise for Luca Guadagnino's sumptuous romance

Review: Mudbound

James Wright isn't so sure about Netflix's big Oscar hope

James Wright reviews one of the standout films of this year's festival circuit

LIFF Review: Western

Valeska Grisebach's film is an excellent addition to the LIFF 2017 lineup

James Wright brings back more news from Leeds

James Wright gives his verdict on Michael Haneke's latest

Review: Justice League

Dominic Payne sinks his teeth into the latest disappointing offering from the DC Comics films

Review: The Florida Project

Andrew Young enthuses over Sean Baker's triumphant new film

Review: The Killing of a Sacred Deer

Giulia De Vita is full of praise for the latest film from the idiosyncratic Yorgos Lanthimos

Review: The Party

Sally Potter's return is a short yet sensational piece of filmmaking, writes Giulia De Vita

Review: Blade Runner 2049

It's finally here, and it doesn't disappoint, writes Andrew Young

Review: Mother!

Euan Brook finds an almost perfect storm in Mother!'s descent into paranoia and sickness

Review: It

Euan Brook finds a perfectly performed, well-written coming-of-age story spoiled by tired horror-movie cliches and a not-so-scary killer clown

Review: God's Own Country

Andrew Young argues that Francis Lee's romance is a confident and full-blooded debut

Something Different: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford

Michael Maitland-Jones gives an overlooked masterpiece some well-deserved exposure

Review: Dunkirk

Daniel Goldstraw finds Dunkirk to be a tense, immersive depiction of the terrors of war that sees Christopher Nolan reach greater heights than ever before
